children.name: the answer to a question in a test, competition, etc
answer a1
children.definition: answer/ˈɑːnsəʳǁˈæn-/  an answer to a question in a test or competition: câu trả lời
examples: ▪ write your answers on the form and send it to this address.
the answerthe correct answer:đáp án
▪ and the answer is ... budapest!
answer to
▪ what’s the answer to question 4?
give your answer
▪ think carefully before you give the answer.
the right/wrong answer
▪ the first person to call with the right answer will win 10 cds of their choice.

children.name: result x
children.definition: result/rɪˈzʌlt/  an answer that you have found after calculating or doing tests: kết quả ( sau khi tính toán, thí nghiệm )
examples: ▪ i’ve tried three different ways of adding these figures and each time i get a different result.
▪ we have completed our experiments and we are now analyzing the results.
▪ the results of our accountant’s calculations show that we are on the verge of bankruptcy.

children.name: solution b1
children.definition: solution/səˈluːʃən/  the correct answer to acomplicatedproblemin a test or competition:
examples: đáp án, lời giải
▪ it was a difficult equation, but it took her only five minutes to work out the solution.
đó là một phương trình rất khó, nhưng cô ấy chỉ mất 5 phút để tìm ra lời giải
solution to: giải pháp cho vấn đề gì
▪ the solution to this week’s puzzle will be published in next week’s magazine.
đáp án cho câu đố tuần này sẽ được công bố vào tạp chí của tuần tới.

children.name: to answer when sb asks you a question or speaks to you
answer a1
children.definition: answer/ˈɑːnsəʳǁˈæn-/  to say something to someone when they have asked you a question or spoken to you:
examples: trả lời/ phản hồi/ đáp lại
▪ julie thought for a long time before answering.
julie đã suy nghĩ trong một thời gian dài trước khi trả lời
▪ i said hello to her, but she didn’t answer.
tôi chào cô ấy nhưng cô ấy đã không trả lời.
▪ ‘why don’t you just leave?’ ‘i’d like to,’ she answered, ‘but i have nowhere else to go.’.
"sao cô không đi đi?" " tôi muốn vậy" tôi ấy trả lời "nhưng tôi không biết nơi nào để đi"
▪ how much did you spend? come on, answer me!
"anh đã xài tốn bao nhiêu tiền vậy? thôi nào, trả lời tôi đi"
answer a question: trả lời câu hỏi
▪ you don’t have to answer the question if you don’t want to.
anh không cần phải trả lời câu hỏi nếu anh không muốn
answer that: trả lời rằng/ trả lời là
▪ when questioned about the robbery, hughes answered that he knew nothing about it.
khi được hỏi về vụ cướp, hughes trả lời rằng anh ta không biết gì về chuyện đó.

children.name: reply b1
children.definition: reply/rɪˈplaɪ/  to answer someone when they have asked you a question or spoken to you - used especially inwrittenenglishto report what someone said:
examples: trả lời, đáp lại ( đặc biệt trong văn viết )
▪ i waited for smith to reply, but he said nothing.
tôi chờ smith trả lời nhưng anh ta chả nói gì
▪ ‘i’m so sorry,’ he replied.
"tôi rất tiếc" anh ấy đáp.
reply to: đáp lại cái gì/ trả lời cái gì
▪ the jailers refused to reply to the prisoners’ questions about where they were being taken.
người cai ngục từ chối trả lời những câu hỏi của phạm nhân về nơi mà họ đang bị đưa đến.
reply that: đáp lại rằng.../trả lời rằng....
▪ we asked jane to help, but she replied that she was too busy.
tôi yêu cầu jane giúp đỡ nhưng cô ấy nói rằng cô ấy quá bận bịu.

children.name: respond b2
children.definition: respond/rɪˈspɒnd tuːǁ-ˈspɑːnd-/  to answer someone, especially someone who hascriticizedyou ordisagreedwith you, in a clear and detailed way:
examples: đáp lại, trả lời, phản hồi ( đặc biệt khi ai chỉ trích,phản đối bạn )
▪ the waitress waited a moment and then responded.
cô bồi bàn ngập ngừng một lát rồi sau đó trả lời.
▪ ‘i’d be there if i could,’ bill responded.
"tôi sẽ đến đó nếu tôi có thể" bill trả lời
respond to: đáp lại/trả lời/ phản hồi đối với
▪ how do you respond to the allegation that you deliberately deceived your employers?
bạn trả lời như thế nào đối với lời viện cớ bạn đang cố ý đánh lừa nhà tuyển dụng?
▪ the meeting will give administrators a chance to respond to the community’s questions and concerns.
cuộc họp sẽ trao cho những nhà quản trị một cơ hội để trả lời những câu hỏi của cộng đồng và những người quan tâm đến.
respond by saying/telling/asking etc: trả lời/phản hồi/đáp lại bằng cách ......
▪ his father usually responds by telling him to be quiet.
bố anh ấy thường xuyên trả lời bằng cách bảo anh ấy im đi.

children.name: give sb an answer a2
children.definition: give somebody an answer/ˌgɪv somebody ən ˈɑːnsəʳǁ-ˈæn-/  to answer someone by telling them what you have decided or by providing them with the particular piece ofinformationthat they have asked for:
examples: cho ai một câu trả lời ( về quyết định của bạn, thông tin họ cần )
▪ they’re offering us a new contract and we have to give them a definite answer by the end of the month.
họ đang đề nghị chúng tôi kí hợp đồng mới và chúng tôi cần phải cho họ một câu trả lời cuối trước cuối tháng này.
▪ he didn’t give me a very satisfactory answer.
anh ta đã không cho tôi một câu trả lời thỏa đáng.

children.name: in response to b2
children.definition: in reply (to)/in answer to/in response to/ɪn rɪˈplaɪ (tuː), ɪn ˈɑːnsəʳ tuːǁ-ˈæn-, ɪn rɪˈspɒns tuːǁ-rɪˈspɑːns-/  if you say or do something in reply to what someone has said, you say or do it as a way of answering their question, request, remark etc:
examples: trả lời, đáp lại, phản hồi
▪ ‘where are we going?’ jill asked. the driver only lifted his hand in reply, as if to silence her.
"chúng ta đang đi đâu?" jill hỏi. người tài xế chỉ nhấc tay để trả lời, như thể là bảo cô ấy hãy im lặng.
▪ ‘that won’t be necessary,’ wilson said in reply to the question.
"điều đó sẽ không cần thiết đâu" wilson nói để trả lời.
▪ in response to your question, no, i don’t think a meeting is necessary.
để trả lời cho câu hỏi của bạn, không. tôi không nghĩ một buổi họp là cần thiết đâu.

children.name: get back to c1
children.definition: get back to trả lời sau ( cần suy nghĩ, thao khảo thêm )
examples: to answer someone at alatertime especially bytelephoningthem, usually because youneed to thinkabout their question or find outmore informationbefore you can give an answer:
▪ she’s promised to get back to me as soon as she hears any more news from the hospital.
cô ấy hứa sẽ trả lời sau cho tôi ngay khi cô ấy không nghe bất cứ tin gì từ bệnh viện nữa.
▪ tell you what, let me talk it over with the guys and i’ll get back to you.
nói cho anh nghe này, hãy để tôi nói chuyện với những gã đó và tôi sẽ trả lời anh sau.
▪ i'm in the middle of a meeting just now, i'll get back to you as soon as it finishes.
get back tosbphrasal verb đáp lạitrả lời
to talk to someone again, usually on the telephone,in order to give themsome information or because you were not able to speak to them before
_i'll get back to you later with those figures.

children.name: retort x
children.definition: retort/rɪˈtɔːʳt/ writtento answer someoneangrily, especially because they haveannoyedyou orcriticizedyou:
examples: trả đũa, trả miếng , phản bác ( một cách giận giữ )
▪ ‘you’re not afraid?’ brenda asked. ‘of course not,’ he retorted angrily.
"anh không sợ à?" brenda hỏi "đương nhiên là không" anh ta gầm gừ trả lời
retort that:trả đũa, trả miếng , phản bác rằng
▪ republicans retorted that the amendment is necessary to balance the budget.
đảng cộng hòa đã phản bác rằng việc sửa đổi là cần thiết để cân bằng ngân sách.

children.name: to answer a question in a test, competition, etc
answer a1
children.definition: answer trả lời
examples: answer a question
you have 20 minutes to answer all the questions.
answer correctly
if you answer correctly, you could win a video camera.

children.name: to find or calculate the answer to a question
solve b1
children.definition: solve to find the correct answer to a question, problem, or sum by thinking about it carefully or doing calculations: giải ra ( câu trả lời )
examples: i’m never going to solve this puzzle - it’s impossible.
according to greek legend, it was oedipus who solved the riddle of the sphinx.

children.name: work out b2
children.definition: work out/ figure outb2  to find the answer, usually a number or amount, to a calculation: tính ra, giải ra, tìm ra ( một con số sau khi tính toán )
examples: it’s all right, i don’t need a calculator. i can work it out in my head.
i’m sure they owe me more money than that - i’ll have to sit down and figure it out.
using a calculator, work out the answers to the following questions.

children.name: to answer a letter, invitation, e-mail etc
reply b1
children.definition: reply/rɪˈplaɪ/  to write a letter to someone who has written to you, or to someone who has put an advertisement in a newspaper:
examples: đáp lại, trả lời, phản hồi
▪ i wrote to franca three weeks ago but she hasn’t replied yet.
tôi viết thư cho fanca 3 tuần trước nhưng cô ấy vẫn chưa trả lời
reply to: đáp lại, trả lời, phản hồi
▪ becky hasn’t replied to our invitation, so i assume she isn’t coming.
becky vẫn chưa phản hồi với lời mời của chúng tôi, cho nên tôi cho rằng cô ấy sẽ không tới.

children.name: answer a1
children.definition: answer/ˈɑːnsəʳǁˈæn-/  if you answer a letter or advertisement, you write a letter to the person who has written it:
examples: trả lời/ phản hồi/ đáp lại
▪ i got the job by answering an advertisement in the paper.
tôi nhận được công việc bằng cách trả lời quảng cáo trang tờ báo
▪ miss millar hired a secretary to answer her mail while she was on vacation
cô millar thuê một thư kí để trả lời mail khi cô ấy đi du lịch.
.▪ think carefully before answering that memo.
suy nghĩ kĩ trước khi trả lời tin nhắn đó.

children.name: write back x
children.definition: write back to write a letter to someone who has written a letter to you: viết thư trả lời, viết lại
examples: ▪ sara wrote asking if she could help, so i wrote back and said yes.
write back to
▪ josh, have you written back to grandma yet?
write sb back
▪ she didn’t really expect him to write her back.

children.name: acknowledge c1
children.definition: acknowledge formal to write a letter telling someone that you have received a letter, parcel etc that they have sent you: viết thư báo nhận
examples: i have just sent off a letter acknowledging their message.
acknowledge receipt of sthofficially acknowledge that you have received something:sự thông báo nhận
please acknowledge receipt of this document by signing and returning the enclosed form.

children.name: in response b2
children.definition: in responseb2/ answera1/ replyb1to sth if you say or do sth in response to what someone has written, you say or do it as a way of answering their question, request, advertisement etc:
examples: she said she’d come to the office in response to an ad she’d seen in the paper.
in answer to recent criticism the president has issued a statement explaining his policies.

children.name: rsvp x
children.definition: rsvp/r.s.v.p./ˌɑːr es viː ˈpiː/writtenplease answer this invitation - used at the end offormalinvitationswhen asking someone to say if they can definitely come to a wedding, formal dinner etc:
examples: xin viu lòng phúc đáp ( kí hiệu dùng cuối thư mời )
▪ dr fischer requests your company at a dinner to celebrate his retirement at the dorchester hotel on november 30th at 10 pm. rsvp.

children.name: sth you say as an answer
answer a1
children.definition: answer sth you say when sb asks you a question or speaks to you: câu trả lời
examples: ▪ each time i ask him when the work will be done, i get a different answer.
▪ i’ve asked yvonne to come on vacation with us, but i’m still waiting for her answer.
the answer is no/yes : câu trả lời không/có
▪ if you’re asking me for money, the answer’s no!
answer to a question : trả lời câu hỏi
▪ the answer to your question is very simple: you failed the exam because you didn’t do any work.
câu trả lời cho câu hỏi rất đơn giản, cậu rới kì thi vì câu không làm bài tập
the answer is (that) : câu trả lời là
▪ why don’t people complain? the answer is that they are frightened of losing their jobs.
tại sao mọi người lại phàn nàn? câu trả lời là họ sợ mất việc

children.name: reply b1
children.definition: reply/rɪˈplaɪ/  something you say when someone asks you a question or speaks to you -use this especially inwrittenenglish to report what someone has said:
examples: câu trả lời , lời đáp
▪ dr kleinert murmured a reply, but i couldn’t hear what it was.
ngài kleinert lẩm bẩm một câu trả lời nhưng tôi không thể nghe được nó là gì.
▪ ‘i’m just borrowing your black dress, ok?’ said maxine, without waiting for a reply.
"tôi sẽ mượn chiếc váy đen của bạn, được không? " maxine nói, mà không cần chờ câu đáp lại.
reply to: trả lời cho cái gì
▪ railway officials say it isn’t their fault - which is their standard reply to customers’ complaints.
công ty đường sắt nói rằng đó không phải lỗi của họ, dường như đó là một chuẩn mực để đáp lại lời phàn nàn của khách hàng.

children.name: response b2
children.definition: response/rɪˈspɒnsǁrɪˈspɑːns/  an answer that clearly shows yourreactionto a question, suggestion etc:
examples: câu trả lời, lời đáp, phản hồi
▪ wagner’s responses showed that he had thought carefully about the issues.
những câu trả lời của wagner cho thấy rằng anh ta đã suy nghĩ rất kỹ về vấn đề đó.
response to: câu trả lời cho/lời đáp cho
▪ ‘sure. why not?’ was his response to most of billie’s suggestions.
"chắc chắn rồi, tại sao không?" đó là câu trả lời cho hầu hết các lời đề nghị của billie

children.name: retort x
children.definition: retort/rɪˈtɔːʳt/  written an angry or cleverly humorous answer, especially to someone who has made you angry: cú trả miếng, trả đũa
examples: ▪ ellie’s angry retort surprised max.
▪ she could never think of a clever retort to counter ben’s string of jokes and witticisms.

children.name: sth you write as an answer
reply b1
children.definition: reply a written answer to a letter, invitation, or advertisement: câu trả lời, lời đáp , phản hồi ( thư, lời mời, quảng cáo )
examples: we advertised for a secretary in the local paper and got 24 replies.
i wrote to them three weeks ago and i haven’t had a reply back yet.
reply to
it is usual to send a formal reply to a wedding invitation.

children.name: answer a1
children.definition: answer a letter that you write back to sb who has asked you for sth: trả lời, phản hồi
examples: we’ve written to the bank requesting a loan, and we’re expecting an answer in this morning’s mail
answer to
did you ever get an answer to your last letter?

children.name: response b2
children.definition: response an answer that clearly shows your reaction to a question, suggestion etc: phản hồi, trả lời
examples: ▪ i mailed the letter on monday and had a response already on friday.
response to
▪ write your responses to the questions on the back of the sheet.

children.name: acknowledgement x
children.definition: acknowledgement/əkˈnɒlɪdʒməntǁ-ˈnɑː-/  aformalletterornotestating that a letter, parcel etc has been received :
examples: lời báo đã nhận , thư lời báo nhận
▪ i received an acknowledgement from toshiba yesterday telling me that they were considering my application for the job.
tôi nhận được lời báo nhận từ toshiba ngày hôm qua nói với tôi rằng
letter of acknowledgement: thư báo nhận
▪ he’s still waiting for a letter of acknowledgement of the last cheque he sent them.
anh ấy vẫn đang đợi thư báo nhận cho séc tiền cuối anh ấy gửi đi.

children.name: answer a2
children.definition: answergo to the doorandopenit when sb knocks:mở cửa
examples: i knocked on the door for a long time, but no one answered.
answer the door
a strange man answered the door.
she still isn’t answering my calls.

children.name: get b1
children.definition: get to go to the door when sb knocks :
examples: get the door
can someone get the door - i’m in the shower!
get itspoken answer the door:

children.name: not answer a1
children.definition: not answer/nɒt ˈɑːnsəʳǁ-ˈæn-/  không trả lời/không phản hồi
examples: ▪ ‘what are you doing here?’ the child’s mouth trembled a little, but he did not answer.
not answer somebody/something:
▪ i’m afraid i can’t answer that question.
▪ i knew there was something wrong when she didn’t answer me.

children.name: no answer a1
children.definition: no answer/reply b1/response b2 there is no answer/reply/response: không phản hồi/ không trả lời
examples: ▪ i called stevie’s name but there was no answer.
get no answer/reply/response:
▪ he’s written three letters to the mayor, but he’s gotten no response.

children.name: make no reply b1
children.definition: make no reply/response/answer/meɪk ˌnəʊ rɪˈplaɪ, rɪˈspɒns, ˈɑːnsəʳǁ-rɪˈspɑːns, -ˈæn-/  to deliberately remain silent when someone asks you a question or talks to you:
examples: không trả lời, phản hồi ( bằng cách im lặng )
▪ i greeted minna, but she made no reply.
tôi chào minna nhưng cô ấy không trả lời
▪ alan tried to start a conversation, but when lockwood made no response, he gave up.
alan đã cố nói chuyện nhưng khi lockwood không trả lời, anh ấy đã bỏ cuộc

children.name: back a2
children.definition: backadverbreturn lại
examples: in reply
_i'm busy at the moment - can i call you back?
_i wrote to donna several months ago, but she hasn't written back yet.
